page.title: 16OKEHAMPTON BIRD LIST PAGE 1
page.content: Within a ten mile radius of Okehampton we are lucky that almost all habitats other than estuaries are present - we have moorland, woodland, rivers, standing water, mud and bogs! I feel that we should consider ourselves fortunate indeed to have such a diversity of habitats within this relatively limited area. We should do all that we can to preserve this heritage for future generations to see,admire and love. The following list is based on my own observations, those of many local people and the Devon Bird Watching Preservation Society Reports back to 1959. After each name is the Scale Rating; 1=very common, 2=common, 3= frequent, 4=uncommon/rare, 5=very rare. Mark Golley. CONTINUED ON THE NEXT PAGE.
